body_html:
I also tried "import tensorflow-gpu as tf" but it gives an "invalid syntax" error.
in the terminal, inside the virtual environment for tensorflow, "pip show tensorflow" yields nothing. However "pip show tensorflow-gpu" shows the version information below:
Name: tensorflow-gpu
Version: 1.2.1
Summary: TensorFlow helps the tensors flow
Home-page: http://tensorflow.org/
Author: Google Inc.
Author-email: opensource@google.com
License: Apache 2.0
Location: ~/venv4Tensorflow/lib/python2.7/site-packages
Requires: mock, numpy, bleach, markdown, wheel, six, protobuf, backports.weakref, html5lib, werkzeug

body:
I also tried "import tensorflow-gpu as tf" but it gives an "invalid syntax" error. 
in the terminal, inside the virtual environment for tensorflow, "pip show tensorflow" yields nothing. However "pip show tensorflow-gpu" shows the version information below:
Name: tensorflow-gpu
Version: 1.2.1
Summary: TensorFlow helps the tensors flow
Home-page: http://tensorflow.org/
Author: Google Inc.
Author-email: opensource@google.com
License: Apache 2.0
Location: ~/venv4Tensorflow/lib/python2.7/site-packages
Requires: mock, numpy, bleach, markdown, wheel, six, protobuf, backports.weakref, html5lib, werkzeug
